title: Mechatronics
description: Microprocessor applications in machine control and product design. Applied electronics. Drive technology; transducers and electromechanical systems. Real-time programming. Mechatronic design methodology. 3 lectures, 1 laboratory.
prerequisites: ME 305 and ME 329 (or concurrent), or CPE/EE 329 and CPE/CSC 369, or consent of instructor
